intro: Elcismia holosericea, commonly known as the silky sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its soft, silky, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine, hairy textures, which help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Elcismia holosericea is often found growing in sandy or gravelly soils, thriving in well-drained conditions.
